title: After how many chat restrictions you start to get banned?
body:
I remember there's like a 7 days ban, then more and more, then perma ban that eventually can be lifted if you act like a saint or something.
Is there an official documentation from Riot on this? I'm at 25 games restriction and I was wondering how many other times I can do that before getting banned, and if I start getting temporary bans, then how many, etc etc

Thanks

10 chat restriction -> 25 CR -> 14 days ban -> perma ban (perma is perma.  there is no lifting)

it's a buildup system.

also think about this, long ago there was a system in place where people were perma chat banned, but that system was removed because people just trolled in other ways (a main one being ping spamming)

Riot punishes based on consistency x severity. 

There has to be a pattern for the system to recognize before they punish you.
Yes it is
but its rly bad. it punishes you for everything. even if u just defend yourself from a toxic player.

Refusing to communicate has not been a report option for many years (even when it was, no one has ever been banned for it alone)

if you find you are losing control, hiding chat and use pings only is the best thing you can do for yourself and for your team.  I think it's safe to say most people would prefer a silence teammate over a flamey one.

It takes games played to drop a punishment tier, not time alone.

On average, it takes 3 months of gameplay to drop a punishment tier. It can be less if you play a lot of games, and more if you don't play a whole lot.
also you can skip tiers of punishment because of zero tolerance words. you can skip from nothing to a 14 day or a chat restriction to a perma
i dont know if you can skip from cr fo perma (skipping 14-days altogether) for zero tolerance alone.  It would need to be serious irl death threats or something.
It's possible to be escalated strait to a permanent ban on an unblemished account if the offense is bad enough.
